comments.commentBody: Yes, that scenario is difficult to believe or understand.
No he won't.  He's trying to "reach out" to African Americans right now, though pandering might be a better word.
Yet nobody has seen this video. I wonder why...
There "appears to be a video?"  Is there a video or not?

Hillary Clinton just convicted the Charlotte cop in a presser. Unfortunately for her, there appears to be video showing that the victim actually did have a gun, not a book. If this is the case, Trump will go after for her convicting the cop, and she will be looking really, really bad.
That was a great stand for moral clarity.
Sure glad North Carolina Legislature saw fit to spend time and resources this year on the REAL issue faced by their citizens - Transgender prohibition in public bathrooms!

Well if you new your history, you would know that we'll regulated meant that gun owners had their guns clean, functional, and ready for use. A militia was the local citizenry. Citizens being prepared to secure their state. Liberals view well regulated as referring to regulations, as we understand the word today and liken militia to today's national guard, which was not the intent of the amendment.
It's not that simple. There are EXPONENTIALLY more police shootings in the U.S. than in the rest of the developed world. Why?
I don't think it's that. I think its the citizens that refuse to hold police accountable the right way. Rioting is the wrong way.

They are dealing with guns. Something none of us would ever dare do. A guy with a gun at your front door? Call a cop. Make another human deal with it. So we are in no position to judge them when guns are involved. "Seemingly not so threatening"? You can't really say till you've been there.

Sterling and Castile both had guns. You can hear the panic in the cops' voices on those videos. ("He's got a gun! Gun!" "I told him not to reach for it!!!") Proof they don't just make that up. So do you count these as "unnecessary shooting deaths"? From someone who would never dare to face a gun, it takes some gall to judge others.

And in a country as vast as America, these events really amount to nothing, not "so many." Magnitudes more killed by guns in all sorts of crazy situations every day, and you live your life just fine not noticing all those. All this attention is wildly overblown. Don't go out in public high on some drug and/or carrying a gun irresponsibly. Those things will get you in trouble, and one or both of those always seem to be a feature of these incidents. White guys doing these things get shot and killed, too. Relax everyone.
If a man or woman, black or white, gets out of a car waving a gun and refuses to put it down, do you think it is cowardly to afraid you might be shot?

Hearing all the "I fear for my life," I get the impression that our police officers scare easy, at seemingly not so threatening situation, and often when there are three or more of them. Does this mean majority of our police officers, despite being armed with deadly weapons, are cowards with neither courage nor the resourcefulness to deal with difficult or just moderately difficult situations?

It breaks my heart to say this as I am a cop fan, with default admiration for people who put their lives on the line to protect others. I feel like I am forced to see our police officers differently now after so many of these unnecessary shooting deaths.

At some point, it becomes clearer that it is not just isolated bad apples or isolated bad calls, but our police has a systemic culture of being scared of black people, prematurely labeling them criminal, reactively use unneeded deadly force.

My children are biracial but appearance wise look like African American. I am already telling myself, if ever I am in trouble, calling police for help is not an option if they are with me.
Really?

how about a Chicago "death watch"?  even with so many shootings there every week, we see no protests, no marquee names, no DOJ pronouncements and no coverage by the NYT. is it possible that to the NYT, black lives don't really matter that much?
Can you site this study?
There are far more whites in theis country right now that any other group.  The percentage of a group getting shot bythe police as compared to the general population is what is important.

Every story like this in The NYT includes the two most recent shootings far away like it. Could we have the list of how many whites or hispanics were shot and killed by police in the same time frame? A recent Harvard Study concluded that a higher percentage of whites and hispanics were killed in confrontations with police than African Americans. The insistence on only mentioning the two recent fatal police shootings of African Americans is inflammatory and on some level misleading.
The article should have mentioned whether or not this was the case.  Sloppy journalism.

would it be really too hard for you to prove that, other than just asserting it to be true

i say most cop k,illings are unjustified, w a few justified

now you prove me wrong
Because the 2nd amendment does not say something like, - for the express and soloe purpose of having a well regulated militia... -   Get it?

OK. Like this?

"Trump ALLEGEDLY defrauded students of Trump University..."
"Trump ALLEGEDLY discriminated against blacks in renting apartments 40 years ago...

But couldn't ( isn't) the law narrowly tailored to apply only to certain flagrant, violent terror acts? And causation principles would presumably continue to apply? Judgment enforcement would be a pain, but it is so in any cross border enforcement proceeding, isn't it? The Saudis' export of violent Wahabism is really what's on trial. The US people help to bankroll that retrograde regime - great if its evil doings were aired in a court and what better circumstance to utilize than the tragic 9/11 attacks? I have full confidence that the Saudis will hire great lawyers, delay for years while they transfer assets out of the US, so won't hurt them economically ( except the outrageous legal fees!) but will make a strong statement to these creepy religious bigots.

There is nothing so special about dying as a result of an act or war or terror or even genocide.  9/11 dead have become totemic for loss (and in some cases highly compensated loss).  I don't think the families of the Oklahoma City bombing were compensated.  The losses in my family came 70 years earlier in the German ovens.
Guess what. There is only one law, ours. Let me translate. International law: how the international elite legally steal everything. And yes it would cause a mess, for them.

Its often said that if you have nothing to hide then you have nothing to fear from being investigated.  The Saudis -- as does the American Government -- have lots to hide and a court-trial with discovery just might bare the skeletons and let them been buried.

Russia along with the genocidal Assad regime has long been targetting hospitals and relief workers and indeed is responsible for the vast majority of civilian deaths in the conflict. It is astonishing how many people in the West including Trump are Putin dupes not realizing that he along with the regime have focused their attacks not on ISIS but on the mainstream Syrian opposition which the US long ago cynically abandoned and is now reaping the rewards of Obama's feckless betrayal of the Arab Spring in Syria, Egypt, Bahrain, and Yemen.

And after bombing Assad, what?  Have we learned nothing from past mistakes?  After Qaddafi, Mubarak, Saddam Hussein were remove chaos and lawlessness followed.  How would Syria be any different?  Be careful what you wish for.
Well stated.
Maybe you have not noticed that Bush has been out of office for 8 years during which a new U.S. regime determined to oust Assad has been in charge.

Well, 60 Syrian butcher, barrel bombers were misidentified in the fog of war and "accidentally" blown to bits like so many they themselves have over time. That's a page right out of Putin's thin book, same excuse as the hit on the convoy, which some on here seem to be attempting to gin up as a conspiracy - have mercy on your sad, confused, apologist souls. Aid workers and roughly 750 lbs of much needed food and medicinal supplies were destroyed as aid workers unloaded them and then another strike when medics rolled up to assist. If it wasn't Russians flying those fighters, perhaps it was ISIS. That second followup attack is right out of the ISIS field manual. Shady.

I say we get shadier and confuse a few more Syrian army barracks for ISIS positions. Perhaps do the same with Assad as well. We'll have another failed state for ISIS to rape until they are driven back, however, ISIS gives up land much easier than Assad. Russia so obviously breaking this cease fire and in such an horrendous way, deserves them their boy goes away. The hopefully they go away. The country is already in ruins, hundreds of thousands have died, many more escaped to live in tent camps, pimp themselves in Beirut. The country is failed, lets put it down finally out of mercy so all can move on.

I've no problem with the theme numbers, except for SECHS, which begins with a Z sound and thus doesn't work for sex. Otherwise, this was an entertaining puzzle to solve. I am, however, disappointed that it wasn't a rebus; I look forward to those on Thursdays.

"We dropped Napalm on the Vietnamese; atomic weapons on the Japanese; indeed, took an entire continent away from its indigenous population."

Indeed. We did that.
And we met with no reprisal.
Those days, decades ago, apparently, are over.
Exactly right! Rascist, xenophobic, bigot (take your ppick) and...ignorant above all else! You said it yourself.

Ahmad Khan Rahami Was Inspired by Bin Laden, Charges Say

Such a statement fails the 'So what test?' as it is only refers to a person not to the common understanding of ethics-values-beliefs-motivation methodology which inspired both to commit terror- against Other not the actual source of the inspiration the cultural schema source which drive behavior.

The title if it was to reflect the true nature of the circumstance:

Ahmad Khan Rahami and Bin Laden were Inspired by the cultural schemas clearly set down in the Muslim Quran and recorded behavior of the Quran's creator Mohammad, Charges should have said.

"C'mon FBI. First the Dad then a year in Pakistan? Even I would have been watching him."

Hard as it may be to believe, most parents do NOT want their sons (or daughters) to be arrested, no matter how weirdly they may behave.

Trying to prevent terrorist acts by people who are already here is foolhardy. Clamping down enough to accomplish that would punish all of us, pointlessly and unfairly. The ONLY way to reduce terrorist attacks (they can't be prevented entirely) is to start minding our own business -- stop jumping into foreign wars where our interests aren't involved and one side professes to "like" us only because we may help them win.

In short: Mind our own business.
You would think odd purchases on E-bay for bomb making stuff would be a red flag?
Authorities have used entrapment to cause certain suspects to jump the gun effectively.
